title: 104_s1340
content: Livestock Concentration Report Act - Establishes a Commission on Concentration in the Livestock Industry composed of the Secretary of Agriculture, cattle, hog, and lamb producers, meat packers, corporate representatives, economists, and antitrust experts to review: (1) the adequacy of the study of concentration in the red meat packing industry. (2) the impact of antitrust, coordination, and other laws affecting the meat packing industry, (3) certain farm-to-retail and other price related data, (4) a specified lamb study. And (5) certain hog processing activities. Requires the Commission to report to the Congress within a specified time, and terminates the Commission within a specified time after such submission.
